author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Gun Debate Goes to Congress
President Trump’s calls for changes to gun laws after last week’s Florida school shooting are pushing Congress toward a politically fraught debate—just months before the midterm elections. Lawmakers have traditionally shied away from any significant changes to gun legislation, in part because of the influence of the National Rifle Association. The NRA not only donates large amounts of campaign cash, mostly to Republicans, but its scorecards on politicians’ pro-gun-rights positions are... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
